paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the W344R mutation in the KCNH2 gene, its effects on channel function, and its association with hereditary epilepsy.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The W344R mutation located in helix A of the CRD, found in patients with hereditary epilepsy.
The W344R mutation located in helix A of the CRD, found in patients with hereditary epilepsy.

functional_data.summary: The W344R mutation decreases channel function and impedes proper folding during translation.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in the reported cases.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on functional assays and clinical correlation.
variants.additional_notes: The mutation was shown to disrupt CaM binding and channel function.
key_quotes: The key pathogenic mechanism of Kv7.2 W344R mutation involves the failure to adopt a configuration that can be recognized by CaM in vivo but not in vitro.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the variant was clearly described in the text.
